39116946.review:
一風変わったガンシューティングです。弾数制限無し、パワーアップアイテム無し、撃っちゃダメなキャラ無し、ボス戦無しと、従来のガンシューティングとは違った物を作りたかったんだろうなーと。しかし、せめてボス戦くらいは欲しかったぞ。ステージのラストに出てくるのは今まで登場した敵キャラ＝女の子の群れなので、専用BGM以外にいまいち盛り上がれる要素が無い。巨大悪魔の背中に乗って空中から攻撃してくる女の子とか、それくらいやってくれても。

普通にクリアするなら簡単です。弾数制限が無いので、ただひたすら乱射してれば初プレイでクリアも可能と思われます。しかしパンツ撮影、ハイスコア狙いで行くと俄然面白くなってきます。パンツ撮影は…まぁ実績解除の為に「仕方無く」、「仕方無く」やりますが、実際は非戦闘エリアである教室や自室に呼び出して撮影すれば実績解除扱いになるので、これは戦闘中にやらなくてもオッケー。

ハイスコア狙いで行くなら、女の子に憑依した悪魔を連続バキュームしてスコアを稼ぐ「デビルスィーパー」、そして女の子を「目がハート状態」にしてのボムアタックが必須となってきます。前者は良いとして問題は後者。ゲーム中チュートリアルでは中途半端すぎてやり方がさっぱり分かりません。何度かやって漸く分かりました、女の子の顔にサイトを合わせ、かつ「近距離に近づく」事が「目がハート状態」ゲージの発生条件です。そしてさらに距離を詰めるとより早くゲージが上昇する…こう言った肝心な事はしっかり書いておけよ！

しかしこのゲーム、この辺を理解すると意外に…某100万人王様ゲームなんぞよりVR性はしっかりしています。障害物をぬって反対側にいるターゲット＝女の子を狙ったり、窓から下の階を覗きこんだり、上記のハートボムアタック時に女の子に近づいたりと、こう言ったVRならではの要素は地味にクリアしてるんですね。よって直立プレイお勧め。このハートボムアタック狙いで行くと、もう一度言いますが俄然面白くなってきますこのゲーム。

しかし弾数制限が無いので、従来のガンシューティングにおける一般人キャラ、つまり「撃ったらダメなキャラ」を入れても良かったんじゃないかなー？と。撃ちまくる爽快感を優先したんですかね？まぁこの世界観で撃ったらダメなキャラと言ったら…男子生徒とか？誤射すると両目をハートにした男子生徒が走ってきて、画面が暗転してｳﾎｯ💛ｱｰｯ‼と言う野太いボイスが…いや冗談です。そしてやっぱりボス戦、欲しかったなぁ。

総評としては、見た目は萌え分たっぷりなのでその辺が苦手な人には手を出しにくいかもしれません、ゲーム自体はガンシューティングとしては変則ルールですが意外ととっつきやすく、楽しいゲームに仕上がってます。ただハイスコア狙いしないとただの温いヴァカゲーなので、活かすも殺すもプレイヤー次第って所ですか。ああ、パンツ撮影も戦闘中にせっせとやった方が面白くなるのかな？まぁ何はともあれ、私はお勧めです。

37990218.review:
[url=store.steampowered.com/app/511740/GalGun_Double_Peace/][u]『ぎゃる☆がん　だぶるぴーす』[/u][/url]をVR化した作品。
原作通り、迫りくる女の子たちをフェロモンショットで撃ち倒し昇天させていく、一人称視点シューティングゲーム。

[h1]原作からの変更点[/h1]
[list]
[*]悪魔を吸い込む「デビルスイーパー」の登場。これの使い方がこのゲーム最大の肝。[strike]スカートもめくれる[/strike]
[*]ドキドキモードの仕様が変わり、女の子をひたすら見つめることでゲージを貯めて発動するようになった。
[*]マップ移動がオートではなくなった。そのためゆっくり隠しアイテムを探せる。
[*]ストーリーモードの排除。
[*]それに伴い天使えころや姉妹等のメインキャラは一切登場しない。
[*]70人いたモブ娘も40人ほどに減っている。人気キャラは一通り網羅しているが…
[/list]

[h1]システム[/h1]
VRシューティングとして非常に面白い。

女の子にはそれぞれ弱点部位が設定されており、そこを撃つことで一撃で昇天させられる。
ただクリアするだけならそれほど難易度は高くないものの、
ハイスコアを狙うならば絶対にコンボを途切れさせてはいけないため、
的確に相手の弱点部位を撃っていかなければならない。
（レティクルを当てた際の反応が「ハッ」→頭、「キュン」→胸、「ビクッ」→尻、「ドキッ」→脚なので参考までに）

また今作から登場した「デビルスイーパー」が非常に重要。
女の子の足止め、ミニくろなの吸い込み（吸い込むことでボーナスポイントがもらえる）ができるスグレモノだが
エネルギーを消費しいくらでも使えるわけではないため、使い所はしっかり見極めなければならない。

ハイスコアを狙う場合は隠しキャラの「ミニくろなメタル」も見逃してはならない。
各ステージのどこかにあるくろな人形を撃つことで出現するので、探してみましょう。

[h1]可愛い女の子たち[/h1]
女の子たちのモデリングはなかなか出来が良く、非常に可愛い。
おまけモードで教室や自宅に好みの女の子を呼び出し、好きなだけイチャイチャすることも可能。
[strike]パンツも覗き放題[/strike]
唯一残念なのは近づきすぎると画面が暗転してしまうことか。

ちなみに僕の推しメンは須藤真紀ちゃんです。

[h1]総評[/h1]
元々がVRと相性の良いゲーム性だっただけに、かなり良質なVRゲーとなっている。
VR環境があるなら是非プレイしていただきたいです。
[strike]プレイ後の賢者タイムの虚しさは異常だけどな！[/strike]
ただストーリー性皆無なので、気になる方はまず原作からやることをオススメします。

http://store.steampowered.com/app/511740/GalGun_Double_Peace/

It's a fun game. The graphics and setting are really spot on. In VR you can really feel you're immersed in any high school anime right away. 

As for playing the game, it's simple but it works pretty well as a wave shooter. Only in this game instead of zombies or whatnot you're cornered by lovestruck high school girls who won't stop at anything until they get to you and profess you their love. 

The interface and presentation is simple enough but that works in favor of the game. Also, it works pretty much flawlessly in Windows Mixed Reality.

I guess it's the best VR anime game I've played but I wonder if there's a lot of them anyway. 

In all, it's a lot of fun, and will keep you amused with visuals and gameplay for a while.

36116978.review:
本作は「ぎゃる☆がんダブルピース」のスピンオフVR作品である。可愛い女の子達に囲まれたい人や、VRガンシューティングを求めている人にお勧めだ。

キャラクター
グラフィックは向上しており、スカートの物理演算が良く出来ている。登場キャラクターはダブルピースよりモブヒロインのおおよそ40名ほどが登場している。

ゲームデザイン
基本的なゲームデザインはそのままに、悪魔を吸い込む掃除機が追加された。これにより発生した突風が女の子のスカートをめくり、あらゆるものを吸い込んでいく。希にどこからともなく飛んできたパンツが吸い込まれていたりと、その吸引力は激しい。実にけしからん。

女の子に近づいて顔を見ると、彼女たちは赤面し目がハートになる。倒せば周囲を巻き込む、いわゆるボムと同じ効果が発動する。人物と見つめ合うという、人見知りには少々難易度の高いテクが要求されるが、VRという操作方法を上手く使ったシステムだ。使いこなせるようになれば、囲まれても切り返しが容易になると同時に人見知りも克服できていいことづくめだ。

今回はスマホを取り出して写真撮影することが出来る。スマホを持っている間はゲームがスローになるので、決定的瞬間（パンチラ）も狙いやすい。また実際にローアングラーになって背徳感を味わう事も可能だ。

任意の女の子を呼び出して鑑賞することが可能だ。目の前でしゃべってくれるだけで戯れたりとかは出来ないが、好きなキャラにお近づき（物理）になれると思えば悪くない。眺めて癒やされたり写真撮影大会を始めるかはプレイヤーの自由だ。

物語
ストーリーがないので簡素に感じてしまうが、シューティングのみを集中して出来るという意味ではシナリオスキップする手間がないので、考えようによっては悪くない。手軽にぎゃる☆がんでVRシューティングを楽しむ作品と割り切った方がいいだろう。


総評
VRのガンシューティングゲームとして手軽に楽しめる作品だ。ネタに走っている部分は多いが、基本的な部分はしっかりと作られているので、ゲームバランスも良好だ。流石のインティクオリティと言える。
殺伐としたシューティングに飽きた人や、女の子と達と戯れたい人にお勧めだ。

VRのキャラゲーをした感想
自分の身長をオプションで設定出来るのだが、170cm台である筆者の視界の高さでは登場キャラクター全員が自分より低身長になってしまう。その為近づくと見下ろす形になる。VRなので身長差もリアルなのだが、普段のゲーム画面では目線の高さに近い位置にあった顔が見れないのは少々違和感を覚えた。これもVRの面白さという奴だろう。むしろゲームとして新鮮な気持ちにさせてくれた。

36099499.review:
For $23.99 I think it was worth it. They put enough changes to make it just barely. I probably would have grumbled at $29.99.  As others have mentioned there is no story line at all. No bosses, no store, no doku doku, no quick time event (which i was looking forward to since I found it a pain with Douple Peace with either mouse or gampad). They have added a sucking machine which is fun to suck up the deamons with and to make the girls scream. The call feature where you call anyone you have unlocked to the class or room is fun. I don't remember if there was a camera mode in Double Peace, but there is one in here. It is no fast paced as other Gal Gun games, which suppresses me since I am much faster using vive controlers than aiming with a controller. About the same as a mouse.  I really enjoy that I can move around and look around. I would have loved it they had added a move feature or teleport feature other than the provided rail jumps. 

One thing that really disapoints me is that there is no DLC. I don't even see a plan for DLC. They have already displayed Gal Gun 2 so looks like they wont be coming back to this one which even though it sounds like I am ragging on the game, it is that I have seen how well Double Peace was done so I know they can do a hell of a lot better. Heck I would have paid 23 bucks just for DLC for Double Peace to be VR. 

In the end Yes I would recommend this as I really do enjoy it as it is. I am on my 2nd play through and probably be a few more since I want to get all the achivements. My wife is looking forward to playing it as well. 

Please developers make some DLC for this OR better yet would be to do what you did here and add VR to Double Peace. I honestly think it would be a pretty easy thing to do.

35162962.review:
Edited Review on 9/27/17

https://youtu.be/EuAKzn1T-lM

Welcome to your very own ecchi harem anime!

Gal Gun VR does an amazing job of putting you inside an anime. I loved the look and feel of the environments and the characters. The voices were great.

The novelty of being an unrestrained pervert was amusing but lets be honest, that's just a novelty. If we really wanted to get perverted in VR there are better outlets... Not that I have any first hand experience mind you... Seriously. Stop looking at me like that...

Once you get past the "Oooh, pretty" and the "lol, wtf Japan" you're pretty much left with a wave shooter. There really isn't any deeper gameplay mechanic to the game that I could find. Shoot the demons, shoot the girls, wash rinse repeat and move to the next position.

Couple that with the headache the game was to get started... The game would launch but nothing would show up. I'd see the game try to launch in the HMD. The loading screen would be visible for about 30 seconds and then it would boot me to a blank white, generic Vive environment with no information as to what happened.

Oh, and the game would still be running so to fix the issue I had to close and reopen Steam...

The ultimate resolution was to put the .exe into compatibility mode for windows 7 (not sure if this is required or not) and to disable my antivirus.

A $30 game shouldn't require you to turn your antivirus software off to run. This above all really hurts the games score for me. The first 2 hours of this game were nothing but failure to start, googling, getting nothing and trying random things. Several times I threw my hands up and said screw it, the games not worth it...

It's cute. It's funny. It's just not worth $30 for a wave shooter on top of the setup issues.

If you're a big ecchi anime buff it may be worth it. If not, you'll probably want to pass on this one.

34741719.review:
Lets start from negative part of this review. It feels like Inti Creates is getting more lazy with every single GalGun game they release. First one was quite unique, with a lot of nice game mechanics and every boss fight was different. Double Peace was pretty much same game, just new story and was taking place 1 year later so it means that 66% of girls were same as in first game. Boss fights were pretty much joke comparing to first game since all of them looked same no matter what route you choose. And now we come to new VR version. It offers same girls as in 2nd game (without MC's), same maps (different routes on them), no bosses, no doki doki mode and no story at all. There are 2 new game mechanics. Suction gun that is used to suck in mini demons for extra points and changed "bomb" system from previous game. this time to turn girl into bomb we need to look in her eyes for few seconds. Sadly suction gun is really boring addition to this game while new bomb mechanic is quite useless since its charging to slow. I don't know if developers simply were greedy and decided to earn some cash at minimal effort or if they though that light novel part might not work in VR. I think it's actually first option since Project Lux already proven that its possible to make good LN game in VR. Last but not least there is possibility to call in any girl, like in previous games where you could go into doki doki mode or simply watch 3D models, In this case there is nothing to do she will just stand and say a few lines, or react to suction gun just like on regular stages.

Now lets get to good parts.
It's still f**** GalGun. So if you are into anime possy full pedo mode then it's game for you. If this dont convince you, then nothing will.

I guess that for people who didn't play previous game all negatives I mentioned wont matter, however long time GalGun players might be a lil bit disappointed just like it was with Double Peace.

34138735.review:
The concept just works a lot better here in VR than in the original game.

The original Gal*Gun was a controller based rail-shooter game with no option to switch to mouse and keyboard. And it played like one. This VR version fixes the controller issues by being a VR game where you can point and shoot in six degrees of freedom, and gives a reason for being on a rail as you move forward from a series of room scale environments. Unlike the original, I beat the game and am fairly happy with the gameplay, and will probably try a few of the score challenge achievements.

One of the reviews calls this a VR horror experience, and mechanically, they're right. You are being swarmed from all sides with entities that you have to shoot who charge right at you. You will get swarmed by multiple girls during some of the encounters which leads to frantic 'omg omg flail shoot shoot' moments, even though thematically, they're professing that they like you. The arena design is nice and diverse; there's not just different configurations of hallways and various open areas, but non-conventional ones like being on a ledge behind a stairwell where you have to worry primarily about what's above and below you.

If this game is for you, you should buy it.

That said, it's not flawless. The menu system should be thrown out and redone from scratch. (Why would you ever make the grip button the 'activate menu item' button while making the trigger button the 'cancel back one level' button? I almost abandoned the game, thinking it shipped broken.) The game will drop back to the empty Steam circle loading area for long periods of time between levels. There's problems clipping with objects in the world. In the 'Call' section of the game, where you can invite a girl to your room, the girl isn't placed inside the play area. There are no Steam Trading Cards. Gal*Gun VR feels like it needs a whole lot of polish but this shouldn't deter you from buying it because it's a glimpse into our waifu future.

34136679.review:
If you played Gal*Gun: Double Peace and the thought of playing it in VR blew your mind, you probably smashed the "Purchase" button as soon as you saw this game and are just reading reviews while it installs and you probably won't be too disappointed in the purchase... 

For the more discerning consumer, though, this is *barebones* compared to GGDP. No story, no sisters, no Doki-Doki Mode, no angels, no devils (aside from the mini-demons that afflict girls), no Doki-Doki Mode, no collectible profiles, no Angel Eye Drops, no store, no sidequests, no Doki-Doki Mode... 

It honestly feels like an Early Access game but it's not marked as one. Like, why is the love gun not modeled at all? It's just a semi-transparent handle. The demon sucker gun is modeled so why isn't the love gun? Second, not having a full story is one thing but the game doesn't even offer a cursory introduction to what's going on so if you didn't play a previous Gal*Gun game, you're going to be confused. It's also weird how aiming is primarily controlled by the motion controller but it's also slightly influenced by the direction you're looking with the headset. In the shooting segments, that's fine, but it's awkward in the menus

Overall, if you're a Gal*Gun fan itching to meet the girls in VR, it's probably worth it. If you haven't played any Gal*Gun games, though, I would recommend playing GGDP before playing this one. I really hope they go on to develop a much more polished and feature-complete sequel.

40492264.review:
[b]Bought it, complete it, returned it![/b]

First off I played this game on the Oculus Rift. The game ran and played well with the Touch controllers. The only issue I had was at the very start of the game. Trying to select around the cell phone to bring up the main menu. After that everything played out as intended, no fighting with the controls for the rest of the play through.

This game was fun for a single playthrough... but that's all. The game had Zero replayability, which is unfortunate. I thought this was a port to VR of the "Double Peace" version of the game, [u]it's not[/u]. There are about 8 levels to play, each lasting 10 minutes at best. Just a simple on rail shooter with no story, mini-games, doki doki bonus rounds or items to collect. Yeah, you can try and beat the top scores. There's also the ability to change the outfits of the girls you encounter. Even the option to hang out with a single girl in the class room or in your bed room back home... but that's [b]All[/b] the game has to offer.

That said, I Really wanted to like this game. But with it's lack of content in comparison to the non-VR version of the game, it just wasn't worth it. 39856765.review:
いわゆるタイムクライシスとかに近いガンシューティングゲーム。VRなので四方八方から来る敵（女の子）を銃で討つゲーム。

VR特有の要素としては、やっぱり視点が動かせるのでキョロキョロして敵を探す動作が楽しい。
あと、視界の外から敵が近寄ってくる場合は声や画面端のガイドである程度目星がつくようにUIが工夫されている。

あと、女の子と至近距離で2秒ぐらい見つめ合うとその女の子がボム（画面全体攻撃）になるという要素がある。
女の子と見つめ合ってる間は他の方向を見ることが出来ず、視界の制限とボムのトレードオフはなかなかおもしろい。
3ｄモデルをじっくり見る機会にもなって良い。

難点をあげると、難易度が低過ぎですぐクリアしちゃうくらいで、
逆にそれ以外はほぼ100満点の古き良きガンシューティングだった。

39757540.review:
AhOh, look out - Teens about!

If you're getting sick of all the typical mass-produced Click-to-Kill games, then it is pretty much your Duty to Buy this one for your VR collection. Then you'll stand at some teleport spot trying not to be noticed, but bracing yourself for the inevitable inrush current. You're not entirely powerless against these girls though. Usually it's just a matter of clicking off the right bait to get past to the next gate. You've also been issued with a reverse-cycle hair dryer and charged with the task of getting Jockey Demons off their head and shoulders, which are demonising girls against your points of defense.

So in summary, keep'em all smiling all the way through some Tokyo High School - without letting any kisses land on you. Schoolgirls rule the powerless tool, too.
